context: Global logistics company, 30000 employees, evaluating autonomous vehicle fleet operations for last-mile delivery

request.purpose: Deploy autonomous vehicle fleet for urban last-mile delivery operations
request.justification: Autonomous delivery offers 40% cost reduction and 60% faster delivery times in competitive urban markets

decision_process.outcome: Confirmed technical feasibility with clear regulatory pathway
Strong business case with 25% IRR and 4-year payback period
Manageable risk profile with comprehensive mitigation strategies
Strong stakeholder support with community partnerships secured
Approved with phased deployment and comprehensive monitoring framework

business_impact.operational_efficiency: 40% reduction in delivery costs and 60% improvement in delivery speed
business_impact.competitive_advantage: First-mover advantage in autonomous delivery with brand differentiation
business_impact.market_expansion: Access to new urban markets previously inaccessible due to labor constraints
business_impact.scalability: Platform for future autonomous applications across logistics network

decision_outcome: Approved $85M investment with phased rollout: $25M for initial fleet acquisition, $35M for infrastructure development, $25M for operations and safety systems; additional $15M contingency fund for regulatory and safety requirements
